code: @Manual{,   title = {genejam: Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.},   author = {James M. Ward},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.20.900},   url = {https://jmw86069.github.io/genejam/}, }

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: Install using remotes package: pak package:
code: remotes::install_github("jmw86069/genejam") pak::pkg_install("jmw86069/genejam")

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: simplest use supply set gene symbols: slightly detail, can edit argument final include things like "SYMBOL" (default), "GENENAME", "ALIAS", "ACCNUM", .
code: genejam::freshenGenes(c("APOE", "APOA", "HIST1H1C")) genejam::freshenGenes(c("APOE", "APOA", "HIST1H1C"),    final=c("SYMBOL",        "GENENAME",       "ALIAS"))

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: frequently find wanting gene symbol, long gene name, created simple function freshenGenes2() uses default argument final=c("SYMBOL", "GENENAME"):
code: genejam::freshenGenes2(c("APOE", "APOA", "HIST1H1C"))

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: common use case include gene aliases, function freshenGenes3():
code: genejam::freshenGenes3(c("APOE", "APOA", "HIST1H1C"))

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: already Entrez gene ID, want associated annotations? function freshenGenes() runs two steps: convert input intermediate (Entrez gene ID) convert intermediate output defined final, example final=c("SYMBOL") create column "SYMBOL". example, Entrez gene ID values column "ENTREZID", use argument intermediate="ENTREZID". case, already "intermediate", invoke function data.frame values column named "intermediate", set try_list=NULL. Similarly, can provide input mixture gene symbols Entrez gene ID values. Shown mixed input. need specify intermediate="ENTREZID" . Notice values "ENTREZID" updated based upon first step resolution "Gene" values "ENTREZID". "SYMBOL" "GENENAME" columns populated using values "ENTREZID".
code: df <- data.frame(ENTREZID=c("348", "4018", "3006", "100")); genejam::freshenGenes2(x=df, intermediate="ENTREZID") idf <- data.frame(Gene=c("MINA", "", "GABRR3", "GABRR3", ""),    ENTREZID=c("", "84864", "", "200959", "200959")) idf genejam::freshenGenes2(x=idf, intermediate="ENTREZID")

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: official gene nomenclature updated multiple times per year, means one Entrez gene ID may different official gene symbol update. comparing data two experiments, important use gene nomenclature. Otherwise, differences results names genes different. microarray platforms provide gene annotations, updated much less frequently official genes. example, Affymetrix array “Clariom D Human” last updated 2016 2018 (document written 2021.) order compare microarray results literature, biological pathways, experiments, gene nomenclature needs updated current version.

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: rare cases official gene symbol “moved” one Entrez gene ID another, usually original Entrez gene ID deleted. cases, reasonable link experimental asay targeted gene gene symbol. alternative use sequence accession number used design assay. result, “best possible” gene annotation strategy used. Entrez gene ID available, use . Entrez official gene symbol available, use determine Entrez gene ID. sequence accession used assay design available, use determine associated Entrez gene ID value values. gene symbol alias available, use determine Entrez gene ID value values associated alias. Sometimes assay measures two genes. steps genejam designed maintain multi-gene associations necessary. one gene symbol alias associated two () genes, genes become associated. Note happens higher priority association already found. Ultimately workflow others along, assemble best available gene annotations given dataset, also leaving behind fewest possible un-annotated entries. one source annotation fails, try another missing entries; .

title: Genejam to Resolve Gene Symbols, Aliases, and Accession Numbers.
text: steps used genejam designed speed, extent providing 100,000 rows return results within seconds . unique values queried, missing entries updated. multiple values combined delimiter, highly optimized method used. Lastly, operations also use optimized mixed-alphanumeric sorting even context list, things like "chr2" appear "chr10" sort order. Incidentally, sort step necessary can compare whether two entries associated genes. one stored "APOE,APOE4" "APOE4,APOE", comparison fails. say, use functions lot need reliable fast. takes seconds just load associated SQLite gene annotation data, process used freshenGenes() usually substantially faster step alone.

what: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes

text: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data

title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
code: freshenGenes(   x,   ann_lib = c("", "org.Hs.eg.db"),   try_list = c("SYMBOL2EG", "ACCNUM2EG", "ALIAS2EG"),   final = c("SYMBOL"),   split = "[ ]*[,/;]+[ ]*",   revert_split = TRUE,   sep = ",",   handle_multiple = c("first_try", "first_hit", "all", "best_each"),   empty_rule = c("empty", "original", "na"),   include_source = FALSE,   protect_inline_sep = TRUE,   intermediate = "ENTREZID",   ignore.case = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
text: x character vector data.frame one columns containing gene symbols. ann_lib character vector indicating name names Bioconductor annotation library use looking gene nomenclature. try_list character vector indicating one names annotations use input gene symbols x. annotation typically return Entrez gene ID, usually given '2EG' end name. example SYMBOL2EG used ann_lib "org.Hs.eg.db" produce annotation name "org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG". Note '2EG' form annotation exist (another suitable suffix defined argument "revmap_suffix" get_anno_db()), derived using AnnotationDbi::revmap(). example "org.Hs.egALIAS" requested, "org.Hs.egALIAS2EG" available, AnnotationDbi::revmap(org.Hs.egALIAS2EG) used create equivalent "org.Hs.egALIAS". final character vector use final conversion step. final NULL conversion performed. final contains multiple values, value returned output. example, final=c("SYMBOL","GENENAME") return column "SYMBOL" column "GENENAME". split character value used separate delimited values x function base::strsplit(). default split values separated comma , semicolon ; forward slash /, trim whitespace delimiters. revert_split logical default TRUE, whether revert internal split argument split, causes columns delimited values split single value per column. revert_split=TRUE columns re-combined match original data. Note values combined using sep delimiter, may identical input data. sep character value used concatenate multiple entries field. default sep="," comma-delimit multiple entries field. handle_multiple character value indicating handle multiple values: "first_hit" query column x finds first possible returning match, ignore subsequent possible matches row x. example, one row x contains multiple values, first match used. "first_try" return first match try_list columns x contain match. example, one row x contains two values, first match try_list using one columns x maintained. Subsequent entries try_list attempted rows already match. "" return possible matches entries x using items try_list. empty_rule character value indicating handle entries match, therefore empty: "original" use original entry output field; "empty" leave entry blank. include_source logical indicating whether include column shows colname source matched. example, column "original_gene" matched "SYMBOL2EG" "org.Hs.eg.db" column "found_source" value "original_gene.org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG". protect_inline_sep logical indicating whether protect inline characters sep, prevent used split single values multiple values. example, "GENENAME" returns full gene name, often contains comma "," characters. commas separate multiple separate values, used split string like "H4 clustered histone 10, pseudogene" two strings "H4 clustered histone 10" "pseudogene". intermediate character string colname x contains intermediate values. values expected output first step workflow, example "SYMBOL2EG" returns Entrez gene values, input x already contains values column, assign colname intermediate. ignore.case logical indicating whether use case-insensitive matching ignore.case=TRUE, otherwise default ignore.case=FALSE perform default mget() requires upper lowercase characters identical match. ignore.case=TRUE function calls genejam::imget(). verbose logical indicating whether print verbose output.

title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
text: data.frame one columns indicating input data, column "intermediate" containing Entrez gene ID matched, one column item final, default "SYMBOL".

title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
text: function takes vector data.frame gene symbols, uses Bioconductor annotation methods find current official gene symbol. annotation process runs two basic steps: Convert input gene Entrez gene ID (intermediate). Convert Entrez gene ID official gene symbol (final). intermediate depends upon annotation used, default condition, Bioconductor gene-centric annotation sources focused ENTREZID primary key integration. Step 1 , values successively queried obtain successful conversion intermediate, specific logic controlled handle_multiple. However, criteria met produces valid intermediate, value values intermediate used Step 2 .

what: Step 1. Convert to Entrez gene ID
title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
text: first step uses ordered list annotations, assumption first match usually best, specific. default, order : "org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG" – almost always 1--1 match "org.Hs.egACCNUM2EG" – mostly 1--1 match "org.Hs.egALIAS2EG" – sometimes 1--1 match, sometimes 1--many multiple Entrez gene ID values matched, retained. See argument handle_multiple custom options.

what: Step 2. Use Entrez gene ID to return official annotation
title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
text: second step converts Entrez gene ID (multiple IDs) official gene symbol, default using "org.Hs.egSYMBOL". second step may optionally include multiple annotation types, returned. common examples: "org.Hs.egSYMBOL" – official Entrez gene symbol "org.Hs.egALIAS" – set recognized aliases Entrez gene. "org.Hs.egGENENAME" – official Entrez long gene name step, annotation matched can returned, audit trail see annotation available input entry. Note input data already contains Entrez gene ID values, can define colname argument intermediate.

title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
text: input data contains column matches argument intermediate, intention pre-existing values honored maintained. result, pre-existing non-empty values intermediate kept without updated. example, data.frame contains colnames 'gene' 'intermediate', values present columns given row, value 'intermediate' used without also querying value 'gene' row.

title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
text: Case-insensitive search particularly useful non-human organisms often use mixed-case gene symbols. support enabled argument ignore.case=TRUE. benchmark tests appears add roughly 0.1 seconds per annotation try_list, regardless number input entries x. seems reasonable cost may increase annotation size, although practice time dependency seem notably affected annotation size. time cost related process converting keys() annotation lowercase, plus relatively minimal time handle scenarios multiple keys mixed case (capitalization) converted lowercase key, example 'CAL', 'Cal', 'cal' recognized 'cal', associated connections combined. secondary step added version 0.0.18.900. Prior version, first matching lowercase result used. vast majority gene-based queries involving human, step necessary produces identical results. reason human gene symbols entirely UPPERCASE.

title: Freshen gene annotations using Bioconductor annotation data — freshenGenes
code:
if (suppressPackageStartupMessages(require(org.Hs.eg.db))) {    cat("
Basic usage
");    print(freshenGenes(c("APOE", "CCN2", "CTGF"))); } #>  #> Basic usage #>   input ENTREZID SYMBOL #> 1  APOE      348   APOE #> 2  CCN2     1490   CCN2 #> 3  CTGF     1490   CCN2  if (suppressPackageStartupMessages(require(org.Hs.eg.db))) {    ## Optionally show the annotation source matched    cat("
Optionally show the annotation source matched
");    print(freshenGenes(c("APOE", "CCN2", "CTGF"), include_source=TRUE)); } #>  #> Optionally show the annotation source matched #>   input ENTREZID    ENTREZID_source SYMBOL #> 1  APOE      348 org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG   APOE #> 2  CCN2     1490 org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG   CCN2 #> 3  CTGF     1490  org.Hs.egALIAS2EG   CCN2  if (suppressPackageStartupMessages(require(org.Hs.eg.db))) {    ## Show comma-delimited genes    cat("
Input genes are comma-delimited
");    print(freshenGenes(c("APOE", "CCN2", "CTGF", "CCN2,CTGF"))); } #>  #> Input genes are comma-delimited #>       input ENTREZID SYMBOL #> 1      APOE      348   APOE #> 2      CCN2     1490   CCN2 #> 3      CTGF     1490   CCN2 #> 4 CCN2,CTGF     1490   CCN2  if (suppressPackageStartupMessages(require(org.Hs.eg.db))) {    ## Optionally include more than SYMBOL in the output    cat("
Custom output to include SYMBOL, ALIAS, GENENAME
");    print(freshenGenes(c("APOE", "HIST1H1C"),       final=c("SYMBOL", "ALIAS", "GENENAME"))); } #>  #> Custom output to include SYMBOL, ALIAS, GENENAME #>      input ENTREZID SYMBOL                             ALIAS #> 1     APOE      348   APOE   AD2,APO-E,ApoE4,APOE,LDLCQ5,LPG #> 2 HIST1H1C     3006   H1-2 H1-2,H1.2,H1C,H1F2,H1s-1,HIST1H1C #>                              GENENAME #> 1                    apolipoprotein E #> 2 H1.2 linker histone, cluster member  if (suppressPackageStartupMessages(require(org.Hs.eg.db))) {    ## More advanced, match affymetrix probesets    if (requireNamespace("hgu133plus2.db", quietly=TRUE) &&       suppressPackageStartupMessages(require("hgu133plus2.db"))) {       cat("
Advanced example including Affymetrix probesets.
");       affy_df <- freshenGenes(          c("227047_x_at", "APOE", "HIST1H1D", "NM_003166,U08032"),          include_source=TRUE,          try_list=c("hgu133plus2ENTREZID", "REFSEQ2EG",             "SYMBOL2EG", "ACCNUM2EG", "ALIAS2EG"),          final=c("SYMBOL", "GENENAME"))       print(affy_df)    } } #>  #>  #> Advanced example including Affymetrix probesets. #>              input ENTREZID     ENTREZID_source  SYMBOL #> 1      227047_x_at    57659 hgu133plus2ENTREZID   ZBTB4 #> 2             APOE      348  org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG    APOE #> 3         HIST1H1D     3007   org.Hs.egALIAS2EG    H1-3 #> 4 NM_003166,U08032     6818  org.Hs.egREFSEQ2EG SULT1A3 #>                                  GENENAME #> 1 zinc finger and BTB domain containing 4 #> 2                        apolipoprotein E #> 3     H1.3 linker histone, cluster member #> 4     sulfotransferase family 1A member 3

text: function convenient extension freshenGenes() adds GENENAME ALIAS default value final=c("SYMBOL", "GENENAME", "ALIAS"). therefore returns three (3) annotation columns default, gene symbol, long gene name, common gene aliases. gene aliases often includes numerous previous gene symbols attributed gene.

title: Get annotation database or environment — get_anno_db
text: x character name annotation object, annotation object . revmap_suffix character string indicting expected suffix can used create reverse-mapped annotation data, example suffix "2EG" used indicate annotation returns Entrez gene. annotation contain suffix, annotation reverse-mapped using AnnotationDbi::revmap(). ignore.case logical indicating whether return environment converting keys lowercase, one implementation choice provide case-insensitive output using standard mget(). option may ideal, see description defailts. order fulfill potential, subsequent mget() must also use tolower(x) input character vector. Note option currently fairly slow, uses memory environment loaded. verbose logical indicating whetheer print verbose output. ... additional arguments ignored.

title: Get annotation database or environment — get_anno_db
text: function simple wrapper function takes either annotation data name, example AnnotationDbi package, annotation object, returns annotation object. event annotation object must derived using AnnotationDbi::revmap(), process performed, reverse mapped annotation object returned. invoking argument ignore.case=TRUE, function returns keys converted lowercase. process can fairly slow (~5 seconds per human genome annotation), results annotation can used directly may faster repeated use calling imget(). alternative ignore.case=TRUE call imget() direct query annotation, call freshenGenes(..., ignore.case=TRUE) call imget() internally. benchmark tests, using imget() appears add roughly 0.1 seconds per query, regardless number input entries. appears time takes spool list annotation keys stored SQLite database, may therefore dependent upon size annotation file.

title: Case-insensitive mget() — imget
text: function lightweight wrapper around base::mget() (generics) intends allow case-insensitive matching. converting keys lowercase, matching lowercase input lowercase keys, using original keys native base::mget(). One small change base::mget() default argument ifnotfound=NA. function secretly runs mget() using unique lowercase input values x, reduce number queries. implementation designed help extremely long potentially highly duplicated input values x, case change greatly reduces time return results. Note: function returns first matching lowercase key, direct assumption keys duplicated converting lowercase. assumption become problem, please provide feedback change method accordingly. Note: unknown reasons, R method dispatch behaving properly objects class "AnnDbBimap", presumably generic functions AnnotationDbi::ls() AnnotationDbi::mget() written class "Bimap". input envir class contains "Bimap" direct function AnnotationDbi::keys() called, fails reason, AnnotationDbi::ls() called, thes AnnotationDbi::mget() called, otherwise generic ls() mget() called.

title: TODO for genejam
text: DONE. Investigate "Lars" “org.Mm.eg.db” ignore.case=TRUE, return multiple results. Issue caused using match(x, tolower(y)) match first valid value. Rare cases different cases stored, example: "Lars", "LARS". 1222 cases 184641 org.Mm.egALIAS2EG 17sep2025, 2 3 instances lowercase alias, example: "cal", "Cal", "CAL". previous behavior return first aliases associated, many cases already correct - however rarer cases additional values associated alternative-case aliases. Resolve issue intermediate values already, amended gene column search produces results. Decide whether existing value used without change, amended new values. Consider option re-collapse expanded columns, e.g. comma-delimited values input.

One key difference empty_rule="original" include full input identifier, first split value. Consider new default: intermediate="ENTREZID" Consider new default: ignore.case=TRUE Add examples showing use array annotations? Consider include something like biomaRt methods. asked Jianying Li examples “goto” queries uses.

title: TODO for genejam
text: Consider enabling string search methods: Use case: Find genes SYMBOL begins "IFN" Use case: Find genes whose GENENAME contains "Receptor" essentially wildcard search, except results ideally returned separated rows. value returning 500 receptors concatenated onto one row. Therefore, workflow likely requires function. : “convert ID official ID” one--one manner, goal freshenGenes(). Consider documenting improved methylation array annotation workflow, whole transcriptome array workflow. Start chip annotation, follow Bioconductor annotations.

title: TODO for genejam
text: freshenGenes() (variants) Consider option re-combine multi-column split values back source column name. example genes separated multiple columns delimited split, can create 50+ column entries, making output unwieldy. Consider changing default argument intermediate="intermediate" intermediate="ENTREZID". change may break older RMarkdown (), however maybe best default use case. Bug review: input contains column values, intermediate column already contains partial data, query column values intermediate empty blank, per handle_multiple argument. Currently appears override augment existing intermediate also querying column value.

title: TODO for genejam
text: Consider adding biomaRt queries supplement fairly limited coverage EnsEMBL gene/transcript identifiers "org.Hs.eg.db" databases Bioconductor. Many retired entries included, without 1:1 mapping EntrezID. unclear step work. attribute can 1:many. Entries longer “key” ENTREZID.

text: input column contains delimiters, split multiple columns one value . However, output data.frame contain original colname original value, proper order. consider adding argument whether include/hide split columns consider adding argument whether include/hide original column

title: TODO for genejam
text: Use case: Search genes description involve something like pattern matching grep example, find “NF-KB” genes, “NF-kB”. need search Kappa symbol? search “histone” “ubiquitin”. Consider changing default argument intermediate="intermediate", intermediate="ENTREZID". Consider helper function microarray annotation. Annotation Affymetrix whole exome array probesets. Annotation Illumina whole genome tiling array. Mimic annotation step oligo array classes. Consider allowing input SummarizedExperiment use either rownames(se) rowData_colnames derived colnames(rowData(se)) process extract relevant data.frame rowData(se), store results back se object. freshenGenes_se(se, rowData_colnames=NULL) use rownames(se) freshenGenes_se(se, rowData_colnames=c("AFFYID")) use rowData(se)[, rowData_colnames] consider input types ExpressionSet, oligo array classes often hard annotate easily.

title: TODO for genejam
text: COMPLETE: Optional case-insensitive lookup Current workflow requires two un-intuitive steps: Prepare annotation library get_anno_db(.., ignore.case=TRUE). step also requires full annotation library input, convenience providing "SYMBOL2EG" example. Also, step fairly slow - 17 seconds prepare three annotation environments. cached, obviously step adds 17 seconds every response time. Convert input lowercase tolower(), query using custom try_list object step 1. solution seems custom function genejam::imget() case-insensitive mget(), prefix indicate case-insensitive.
code: library(genejam) try_dbs <- list(org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG=org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG,    org.Hs.egACCNUM2EG=org.Hs.egACCNUM2EG,    org.Hs.egALIAS2EGorg.Hs.egALIAS2EG=org.Hs.egALIAS2EG) system.time(try_list <- lapply(try_dbs, function(i){    get_anno_db(i, ignore.case=TRUE) })) freshenGenes3(tolower(c("TRKB", "ApoE")), try_list=try_list)

title: TODO for genejam
text: Trickier example showing mix input types: Final example showing input intermediate column:
code: idf <- data.frame(Gene=c("MINA", "MINA", "GABRR3", "GABRR3", "APOE"),    ENTREZID=c("", "84864", "", "200959", "84864")) idf genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID") genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID", handle_multiple="first_hit") genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID", handle_multiple="first_try") genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID", handle_multiple="all") genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID", handle_multiple="best_each") genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID", include_source=TRUE) idf <- data.frame(Gene=c("MINA", "RIOX2", "GABRR3", "GABRR3", "RIOX2,GABRR3", ""),    ENTREZID=c("", "84864", "", "200959", "", "84864,200959")) idf genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID") genejam::freshenGenes2(idf, intermediate="ENTREZID", include_source=TRUE) idf <- data.frame(Gene=c("MINA", "RIOX2", "GABRR3", "GABRR3", "RIOX2,GABRR3", ""),    ENTREZID=c("", "84864", "", "200959", "", "84864,200959")) idf genejam::freshenGenes2(idf[,"ENTREZID",drop=FALSE], intermediate="ENTREZID")

title: TODO for genejam
text: currently possible provide ENTREZID values input, since values expected "intermediate" column first step process. annotation takes ENTREZID returns ENTREZID. close -pass supply data colname "intermediate", works breaks actual use "intermediate". Allow "ENTREZID" "EG" input column, mechanism allow input data intermediate value, without query annotation. essentially mark one columns something like "AsIs" values delimited used populate "intermediate" column without query. special-case ann_lib="ASIS" allow values "AsIs" columns pass , give mechanism try querying another column first, using "ASIS" column secondary option.

title: TODO for genejam
text: change requires something like better_mget() perhaps properly imget(). basic mechanism: {r, imget} input <- c("Apoe", "h1-3", "Hist1H1C"); keys <- ls(org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG) keymatch <- match(tolower(input), tolower(keys)) keysfound <- !.na(keymatch); values <- .list(jamba::nameVector(rep(NA, length(input)), input)) valuesfound <- mget(keys[keymatch[keysfound]], org.Hs.egSYMBOL2EG, ifnotfound=NA) values[keysfound] <- valuesfound; values; testing, appears slow step retrieving keys, also performed time data queried, compounding problem. Current recommendation use get_anno_db(..., ignore.case=TRUE) returns environment keys forced lowercase. case, environment consumes real memory, takes longer prepare. However prepared, environment can passed directory freshenGenes() rapid operation.

title: TODO for genejam
text: asis_colnames=c("ENTREZID","EG") define colnames c("ENTREZID","EG") “ASIS” means queried. ann_lib=c("ASIS", "SYMBOL2EG", "ALIAS2EG") process order: take values asis_colnames delimit populate "intermediate" column. query "SYMBOL2EG" using columns except asis_colnames. query "ALIAS2EG" using columns except asis_colnames. ann_lib=c("SYMBOL2EG", "ASIS", "ALIAS2EG") process order: query "SYMBOL2EG" using columns except asis_colnames. Populate "intermediate" delimited values asis_colnames using rules defined handle_multiple. , handle_multiple="first_try" rows empty values `“intermediate” column populated. query "ALIAS2EG" using columns except asis_colnames.

title: Version 0.0.20.900
text: Changed GPL-2 MIT license, added proper LICENSE files.

title: Version 0.0.20.900
text: freshenGenes() Fixed empty_rule="original" ‘ENTREZID’ populated valid, causing final entries empty. Now properly fills original value. Fixed intermediate column (‘ENTREZID’) NA instead “” empty values. situation occurred input data.frame also included intermediate column. Previously rows filled properly.

title: Version 0.0.19.900
text: Moved ‘AnnotationDbi’ Imports. ## Bug Fixes Fixed regression 0.0.18.900 “first_try” caused behave like “first hit”. Fixed regression ignore.case=TRUE caused correction handle multiple identical values converted lowercase. Added testthat confirmation ignore.case=TRUE, revert_split=TRUE, sources, etc.

title: Version 0.0.19.900
text: freshenGenes() New argument revert_split=TRUE re-combine columns previously split argument split. process took delimited values, split individual columns, performed matching singular values. Previously data left -review, however new default combine columns using sep delimiter, consistency delimiter style function. New default value argument intermediate="ENTREZID". Previous 'intermediate' useful informative, although flexible. still flexible, default case now informative.

title: Version 0.0.18.900
text: Previously ignore.case=TRUE rare cases return subset associated genes, multiple alias values differed case, example "cal", "Cal", "CAL". issue affects values mixed-case, thus human entries unlikely affected (human gene symbols already UPPERCASE.) Somebody recognizes case, since ‘cal’, ‘Cal’, ‘CAL’ map 1--1 one Entrez gene, ‘Gopc’, ‘Fblim1’, ‘S100a11’, respectively. Bless.

title: Version 0.0.18.900
text: freshenGenes() input data contains colname equal argument intermediate, existing values column considered “complete” additional values amended alongside .

title: Version 0.0.17.900
text: Bumped jamba 1.0.4 pointed CRAN instead Github.

title: Version 0.0.16.900
text: bumped version dependency jamba 0.0.87.900, due bug introduced jamba::cPaste() adversely affected output accessions require multiple rounds querying.

title: Version 0.0.15.900
text: freshenGenes() new argument ignore.case calls genejam::imget() drop-replacement mget(). process improved calling AnnotationDbi::keys() instead AnnotationDbi::ls(), change least order magnitude faster. brief benchmarks, using ignore.case=TRUE adds roughly 0.1 seconds per annotation try_list, otherwise speed regardless number input entries.

title: Version 0.0.14.900
text: freshenGenes() updated input can contain intermediate values, example ENTREZID values. fact, now input can contain mixture gene symbols, ENTREZID intermediate values, fill holes accordingly. new argument intermediate define colname contains intermediate values, commonly EG Entrez gene ID. Values propagated intermediate except handle_multiple="first_hit" existing value intermediate used processing. handle_multiple combine entries intermediate.

title: Version 0.0.14.900
text: is_empty() small helper function determine entries vector either NA "".

title: Version 0.0.13.900
text: two new functions convenience functions. often find wanting gene symbol long gene name, now freshenGenes2() default. add gene aliases, use freshenGenes3(). freshenGenes2() simple extension freshenGenes() "SYMBOL", "GENENAME" output default. freshenGenes3() simple extension freshenGenes() "SYMBOL", "GENENAME", "ALIAS" output default.

title: Version 0.0.12.900
text: get_anno_db() logic check reciprocal annotation names updated cover scenarios. Specifically, "org.Hs.egUNIPROT2EG" properly recognized, previously recognized reciprocal "org.Hs.egUNIPROT" therefore skipped.

title: Version 0.0.11.900
text: prepare wider release, decided rename (!) arguments, snake_case instead camelCase consistency. heard complaining package, “arguments camelCase others snake_case? Pick one!” complain smile face, still ’s fair point. finalList now final tryList now try_list annLib now ann_lib suppose probably rename freshenGenes() freshen_genes().

title: Version 0.0.11.900
text: get_anno_db() new argument ignore.case build environment keys converted lowercase. Ultimately, option incurs lowest performance hit, since keys need converted , environment can used repeatedly native mget() functions.

title: Version 0.0.11.900
text: imget() case-insensitive mget() – however tested , realized mechanism fairly slow using fairly large annotation object. Also, querying data multiple times using imget(), re-use cost incurred operation – much ideal. function likely retired soon.

title: Version 0.0.10.900
text: better_exists() better_get() (humbly) improved versions base::exists() base::get() respectively. sole benefit recognize package prefix object name, things like better_exists("base::get") return TRUE since object exist; subsequently better_get("base::get") return object. functions mostly useful using annotation package prefixes "KEGG.db::KEGGPATHID2NAME". needed simple way test exists. better_exists() also allows multiple input values.

title: Version 0.0.10.900
text: get_anno_db() now calls better_exists() better_get() allows using package prefix annotation names. get_anno_db() argument "revmap_suffix" now allows multiple possible values, cycles finds match, otherwise returns NULL. annotations use suffix "2ENTREZID" instead "2EG", still others use "2NAME". ’m sure others.

title: Version 0.0.9.900
text: freshenGenes() new argument handle_multiple="best_each" returns best first try delimited entry input row. example c("APOE","APOA") match "APOE" authoritatice gene symbol, "APOA" matched alias new gene symbol "LPA". output "APOA,LPA". Note output contain unique entries delimited, sorted.

title: Version 0.0.8.900
text: next version handle_multiple="best_each" find best match entry set delimited gene symbols. useful something like pathway enrichment results, goal retain possible genes, yet gene may require different type annotation find match. See TODO.md details.

title: Version 0.0.8.900
text: freshenGenes() includes new example showing recognize Affymetrix probesets using custom search library. freshenGenes() handles multiple annotation libraries, mostly form fully described annotation names, "org.Hs.egSYMBOL" "hgu133plus2ENTREZID". freshenGenes() new option empty_rule="na" replace empty entries NA. options empty_rule="blank" replaces "", empty_rule="original" replaces empty entries first output column original entry first input column. get_anno_db() now returns`NULL annotation found, instead throwing error. change allows calling function skip missing annotation gracefully without using tryCatch() catch error.

title: Version 0.0.7.900
text: freshenGenes() now properly ignores NA values without throwing exception. NA values left -returned NA final output.

title: Version 0.0.6.900
text: freshenGenes() new argument protect_inline_sep helps prevent splitting single values may include sep character, example splitting "H4 clustered histone 10, pseudogene" "H4 clustered histone 10" “pseudogene". Also, handling finalList uses sep split since sep known used creating intermediate values, therefore consistent final step. subtle change helps allow general split pattern first step, "[, ]+" splits comma /space, without splitting spaces subsequent steps.

title: Version 0.0.6.900
text: lgsub() simple wrapper around gsub() except operates character vectors inside list. function probably moved jamba package near future. fact, probably small family list-friendly functions: lgrep(), lvigrep(), lvgrep(), lstrsplit().

title: Version 0.0.5.900
text: get_anno_db() updated handle reverse-map annotations, example requesting org.Hs.egALIAS deriving org.Hs.egALIAS2EG using AnnotationDbi::revmap().

title: Version 0.0.4.900
text: Another update resolve cascade stringsAsFactors bugs. Least favorite default option R.

title: Version 0.0.3.900
text: Force input x character freshenGenes().

title: Version 0.0.2.900
text: Note genejam requires one Bioconductor annotation package, usually org.Hs.eg.db can valid organism, org.Mm.eg.db mouse, org.Rn.eg.db rat.

title: Version 0.0.2.900
text: Attempt fix rare cases NA values mget() using jamba::rmNA().
